On International Yoga Day, UN spotlights power of ancient practice to help ease COVID stress Link: /en/story/2020/06/1066742

Culture and Education Link: /en/news/topic/culture-and-education

The UN celebrates the sixth annual International Day of Yoga Link: https://www.un.org/en/observances/yoga-day on 21 June, recognizing the ancient practice as a holistic approach to health and wellbeing, and a powerful tool for dealing with the myriad stresses brought on by the COVID-19 pandemic

FROM THE FIELD: the plight of refugees persecuted for their sexual orientation Link: /en/story/2020/06/1066532

Migrants and Refugees Link: /en/news/topic/migrants-and-refugees

Millions of people around the world are at risk because of their sexual orientation or sex characteristics. The UN refugee agency, UNHCR, has underlined the fact that, under international law, they must be protected as refugees. 

IOC/ISABELLA BONOTTO

Refugee athletes stay focused on countdown to delayed Olympics Link: /en/story/2020/06/1066522

Migrants and Refugees Link: /en/news/topic/migrants-and-refugees

With the Tokyo Olympics delayed until 2021, UN News has spoken to two recipients of Refugee Athlete Scholarships, an initiative of the International Olympic Committee (IOC), and UN refugee agency (UNHCR), to find out how COVID-19 lockdown measures are affecting their preparations for the games.

UN chief appeals for restraint following protests in Mali Link: /en/story/2020/06/1066762

Peace and Security Link: /en/news/topic/peace-and-security

The UN Secretary-General has appealed for calm in Mali, following protests in the capital, Bamako, on Friday.

World Refugee Day: End conflict that drives ‘appalling’ displacement numbers Link: /en/story/2020/06/1066592

Migrants and Refugees Link: /en/news/topic/migrants-and-refugees

UN Secretary-General António Guterres has reminded countries of their fundamental obligation to protect the nearly 80 million people worldwide forced to flee their homes due to conflict, persecution and other crises.

The World Health Organization (WHO Link: https://www.who.int/ ) reported the largest single-day increase in coronavirus cases over the course of Sunday, registering more than 183,000 new infections in 24 hours, bringing the total to some 8.8 million cases worldwide, with more than 465,000 deaths.
